intro: Roupala monosperma, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its clustered, white, fleshy flowers that resemble balls, hence its common name. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is a distinguishing feature of the species. The tree is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
